title: Old discussion, Valid topic.
body:
There needs to be some more lenience _(or at least clarity)_ around your end of game grade _(S rank etc)_ regarding CS in extreme circumstances.

Obviously CS is important, but I think it has a little too much weighting in some cases.

For example, this lux game of mine:
http://imgur.com/a/G13Xl

Yes it's true, i should have near double that amount of CS. But I'm sorry, I was too busy farming champions. 
Im not Yasuo, I cant 1-hit entire waves passively. I have mana and cool downs, I need to use spells to either clear or kill. Therefore one stat must suffer in order to support the other. :P

A perfect game with half kill participation and double digits kills and assists.
Is that honestly worth no more than an S-? 

But is is still an S, so I cant really complain.
I only put that in to soften you up for exhibit 2!

_____

**Exhibit 2:**
My friend's Evelynn game.
http://imgur.com/a/nbC6m

Yes, again, the farm could have been higher, he admits it.

But basically 40 kills? not to mention only 6 deaths (for a remarkably squishy champion) in an hour long game? with 75% kill participation? _(honestly, how do you even get 75% kill participation in a 60 min game?)_
Not even worth an A+

After that, I actually pity Evelynn mains. Like seriously how many virgin souls do you have to sell to the devil in order to get lvl 6 or 7? When 39/6 is just an A...

I know that the grade is based around average scores. But there needs to be some kind of fail-safe for after you get past a certain point, and enter the realms of ridiculous KDA. Where it just gives you S regardless of all your other stats like CS or vision.

replies.body:
I'm a Level 7 Evelynn one-trick and, while I've never gotten 40 kills in a game (good on your friend xD), I am consistently getting S ranks. 

- I get 200-300 CS a game (usually end up with the most CS). 
- When I do die, my deaths aren't all clumped together (I think a certain number of deaths in a short time affects the grade). 
- I focus objectives. How many towers/inhibitors/dragons/etc. also plays a role in your grade. I had a game where I went 7/4 but because I literally took EVERY objective I still got an S. 
- WARDING. I bad with warding, but in a lot of my games, I'm still out-warding my support (warding also helps with the death thing mentioned above). 
- Gold. It's all well and good killing one person 50 times, but if they don't get a gold reset, they only give about 50-70g. While it may make your KDA look good, it won't give you much of a gold lead. 

That's all I can think of. Hope this helps you (and your Evelynn friend) out :D Also, if you get 40 kills, you may want Mejai's xDDDDD

My friend is already lvl 7 Eve, _(boy was it a slog though, i remember being in the games.)_

But he plays Eve like Shaco, he scouts out early kills and then snowballs from there, almost completely abandoning CS to help the team with lane dominance and objectives.

all of that is goof advice though, ill show him your comment!

I'm pre sure that the CS has to balance right with the KDA.
And also taking the time into account, that and gold intake.

So your eve game:

39/6/18
With 141 cs at 56:14.

39 kill and 18 Assist is IMPRESSIVE.
6 Deaths is jesus fuck, you pro.

But your CS is shit, IK you said you were 'Farming Champs', but you are to have like at least over 200 cs at 35 minutes or less.
So really your downfall is your CS in this scenario.

Your Lux game is something I'm trying to get over doe xD


Also you gotta check out your average KDA and compare that to your game KDA that you got.

Yea, but my point is that if you do have 40 kills.
CS shouldn't even matter.

and it was my friends Eve game haha
